subject: Re: [junit] false positives with expected=AnException.class?
msgSnippet: ... Yes.  If this might happen, you can either fall back to the try/catch approach or break your test down further (if your test method invokes another method,
messageBody:
On 6/29/06, berndq <berndq@...> wrote:
>
>
> Hi all,
>
> I can see that this is nicer than a try/fail/catch construct.
>
> But what if the same exception type is thrown from another place
> than the expected one (inside the same test method)? Can't we have false
> positives then?


Yes. If this might happen, you can either fall back to the try/catch
approach or break your test down further (if your test method invokes
another method, see if you can test that other method in a different test).

--
Cédric
http://testng.org


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
